etymologies: early 19th century (in an earlier sense). From French sittine, noun from scientific Latin Sitta, genus name (LinnaeusSystema naturae (ed. 10, 1758) I. 115; from post-classical Latin sitta from ancient Greek σίττη nuthatch, probably of imitative origin) + French -ine

definitions: Belonging to or characteristic of the group of arboreal passerine birds comprising the true nuthatches (genus Sitta).

notes.text: The group is now either equivalent to the family Sittidae, or distinguished as a subfamily Sittinae when other birds are included in the family.
